dialogue.text: Freedom has teeth because the universe pushes back. That's what makes it sacred.

psychological_notes: The architect concludes with profound simplicity. Freedom isn't abstract but has 'teeth' - it bites, it costs, it demands. The universe's pushback isn't obstacle but gift, creating the resistance against which choice becomes real. The sacred emerges not despite difficulty but because of it.
philosophical_underpinning: The sacred emerges from engagement with resistance
therapeutic_direction: Finding gratitude for the very constraints that make freedom possible
